export const RightArrow = () => <svg
    viewBox="0 0 14 14"
    width="8px"
    height="14px"
    style={{
      marginLeft: '4px',
      display: 'inline-block',
      shapeRendering: 'inherit',
      verticalAlign: 'middle',
      fill: 'currentColor',
      'path fill': 'currentColor'
    }}
>
  <path d="m11.1 7.35-5.5 5.5a.5.5 0 0 1-.7-.7L10.04 7 4.9 1.85a.5.5 0 1 1 .7-.7l5.5 5.5c.2.2.2.5 0 .7Z" />
</svg>

<Meta title="Introduction/Installation" />

<div className="sb-container">
  <div className='sb-section-title'>
    # Installation

    Here you can check how to install **OSS UI kit** in your app.

    ## From Git repo
      To install the latest commit of main branch, you can specify which url to use with the following syntax:

      ```bash
      npm install https://github.com/pfizer/oss-ui-component-library.git
      # or with specified branch
      npm install https://github.com/pfizer/oss-ui-component-library.git#dev
      ```

    ## Install local from existing package (only for local dev testing)
      If you want to install inside test project, before contribute to **OSS UI kit**, you can easily run following command inside package:

      ```bash
      npm link
      ```

      then inside your test app run:

      ```bash
      npm link hlx-ui
      ```

      After installation you can import components from library to your app:

      ```javascript
      import Grid from 'hlx-ui/Grid';
      import Alert from 'hlx-ui/Alert';
      import Cell from 'hlx-ui/Cell';
      ```



  </div>
</div>
